content: Singaporean non-governmental organisation[Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/Southeast_Asian_haze) seriesHaze in [Borneo](/wiki/Borneo), (/wiki/2019_Southeast_Asian_haze)History1990s - [1997 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/1997_Southeast_Asian_haze) - [1997 Indonesian forest fires](/wiki/1997_Indonesian_forest_fires) 2000s - [2005 Malaysian haze](/wiki/2005_Malaysian_haze) - [2006 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/2006_Southeast_Asian_haze) - [2009 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/2009_Southeast_Asian_haze) 2010s - [2010 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/2010_Southeast_Asian_haze) - [2013 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/2013_Southeast_Asian_haze) - [2015 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/2015_Southeast_Asian_haze) - [2016 Malaysian haze](/wiki/2016_Malaysian_haze) - [2016 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/2016_Southeast_Asian_haze) - [2017 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/2017_Southeast_Asian_haze) - [2019 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/2019_Southeast_Asian_haze) Key topics - [Chemical equator](/wiki/Chemical_equator) - Deforestation - [in Borneo](/wiki/Deforestation_in_Borneo) - [in Indonesia](/wiki/Deforestation_in_Indonesia) - [Mega Rice Project](/wiki/Mega_Rice_Project) - [Peat swamp forest](/wiki/Peat_swamp_forest) - [Borneo](/wiki/Borneo_peat_swamp_forests) Responses - [ASEAN Agreement on Transboundary Haze Pollution](/wiki/ASEAN_Agreement_on_Transboundary_Haze_Pollution) - [Operation Haze](/wiki/Operation_Haze) - [Transboundary Haze Pollution Act 2014](/wiki/Transboundary_Haze_Pollution_Act_2014) - People's Movement to Stop Haze See also - [Air pollution in Malaysia](/wiki/Air_pollution_in_Malaysia) - [API](/wiki/Air_Pollution_Index) - [Singapore PSI](/wiki/Pollutant_Standards_Index) - [Social and environmental impact of palm oil](/wiki/Social_and_environmental_impact_of_palm_oil) Category - v - t - e **People's Movement to Stop Haze** (PM.Haze) is a [non-governmental organisation](/wiki/Non-governmental_organization) based in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore). It was founded in 2014 in response to the [2013 Southeast Asian haze](/wiki/2013_Southeast_Asian_haze), which has been recognised as one of the most serious [haze](/wiki/Haze) episodes in over 16 years. PM.Haze started its work with an investigative research project to fire-prone areas in Riau Province, Indonesia and identified [peatland](/wiki/Mire) degradation due to mismanagement of concession lands by irresponsible companies as the fundamental cause of the fires in the areas and the resulting transboundary haze pollution. In 2016, it became registered as a society. In 2017, it underwent a rebranding exercise and adopted a new logo to symbolise a constant flow for fresh, clean air with an arrow pointed upward to represent constructive action towards this. PM.Haze was mentioned by Minister for the Environment and Water Resources [Masagos Zulkifli](/wiki/Masagos_Zulkifli) as he delivered Singapore's national statement at the [United Nations](/wiki/United_Nations) Environment Assembly in [Nairobi](/wiki/Nairobi) in December 2017. ## Aims As a [people's movement](/wiki/Social_movement), it focuses on outreach, research and [advocacy](/wiki/Advocacy_group) on haze related concerns. It aims to empower people with the knowledge, values and means to be drivers of global action to stop the haze and ultimately attain clean air for present and future generations. ## Work PM.Haze conducts advocacy workshops, research efforts, and runs campaigns to increase [awareness](/wiki/Awareness_campaign). It took part in the [ASEAN](/wiki/Association_of_Southeast_Asian_Nations) Forum of National Bioethics Committees (NBCs) on Haze Pollution in [Jakarta](/wiki/Jakarta), Indonesia on 6 and 7 December 2017. PM.Haze also conducts trips to [Indonesia](/wiki/Indonesia) and [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia) called "People's Expedition to Experience Peat (PEEP)". This is one of its on-the-ground solutions to enable people to experience the realities on the ground while directly helping out in projects to prevent fires and haze. In May 2017, it went to Sungei Tohor, a small village in the [Riau](/wiki/Riau) province in Indonesia to build a canal block as part of the solution to stop haze. ### Campaigns #### 2015: We Breathe What We Buy In 2015, PM.Haze launched the "We Breathe What We Buy" campaign in conjunction with the [World Wildlife Foundation](/wiki/World_Wide_Fund_for_Nature) (WWF). This campaign uses the #XtheHaze tagline to encourage people to switch to brands that produce [sustainable](/wiki/Sustainable_agriculture) [palm oil](/wiki/Palm_oil). #### 2016: Go Haze Free Following from this, the #GoHazeFree campaign was launched in 2016. It aims to encourage businesses to change to sustainable palm oil.
title: People's Movement to Stop Haze
